titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Breed Collection of Maps, Documents, and Prints, 1545-1973
titlestmt.author: Inventory prepared by Archives and Special Collections Library

publicationstmt.publisher: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Laura Streett, 2018

did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Breed Collection of Maps, Documents, and Prints

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

did.abstract: Collection of maps, charts and atlas pages, documents, and illustrations depicting various regions of the globe ranging from the 16th to 19th centuries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Collection of maps, charts and atlas pages, documents, and illustrations depicting various regions of the globe ranging from the 16th to 19th centuries. Of particular note are maps of Great Britain, Germany, Italy, the North American colonies, and South America. The documents relate to Peter Chester, Colonial Governor of West Florida. All measurements are approximate.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research according to the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library without any additional restrictions.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to quote (publish) from unpublished or previously published material must be obtained as described in the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library.

p.archref: Edward Lasker Collection of Atlases and Maps
Richmond John Rathbone Collection of Rare Maps

odd.head: Encoding Information
odd.p: Encoded by Laura Streett, July 2011. Updated October 2018 and January 2019. Last updated by Emma Gronbeck, September 2024.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Earliest processing date unknown. Updated by Maya Peraza-Baker, 2008. Material unrelated to original Breed Collection removed, collection rehoused, and described by Janine St. Germain in 2019.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Breed Collection of Maps, Documents, and Prints, Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The maps are organized into series roughly by geographic area. There is considerable overlap between the sub-series, though, so careful browsing is required to complete a thorough search of the collection.
Within each series, maps are arranged in item number order.

unittitle.ref: MAPS — EUROPE — TWO OR MORE COUNTRIES

did.unittitle: MAPS — AFRICA
A New Map of Egypt from the latest authorities, by John Cary, Engineer,
A New and Correct Map of Africa laid down from the most Exact Observations and Discoveries,

scopecontent.p: — Insets: Customs of the natives; View of Cape of Good Hope.

did.unittitle: Fezzae et Marocchi regna Africae celeberrima, Describebat Abrah: [Abraham Ortelius, 1527-1598],

scopecontent.p: — Text containing descriptions of Fessanvm and Mavrocanvm attached.
— Total of 3 leaves joined together, unnumbered.

did.unittitle: To the Right and Honorable Charles Earl of Peterborow and Monmouth, etc. This map of Africa . . . is most humbly dedicated by: [Herman Moll] Geographer, [London],

scopecontent.p: — Insets: View of Cape of Good Hope with 3 plans of fortifications.

did.unittitle: Totius Africae Nova Repraesentatio . . . , a Io Baptista Homanno [Johann Baptist Homann, 1663-1724] . . . Norimbergae,
Africa, According to Newest and most Exact Observations By Herman Moll Geographer,
Aphricae Tabvla I, [Northwest Africa and southern coast of Spain],

scopecontent.p: — In pencil: "Munster's Ptolemy 1552."
— Text on verso: "Aphricae . . ."

did.unittitle: MAPS — ASIA
Tabula Tartariae et majoris partis Regni Chinae, editae a [Frederik de Wit, 1629 or 1630-1706] [Amsterdam],
Asiae: Nova Descriptio Auctore Iodoco Hondio,

scopecontent.p: — On verso: pages 343-344, "Novvelle Asie."
— Decorative motif at center of each page.
— "Nnnnnnn" on lower part of right-hand page.
— Insets: Christian Church at Jerusalem; Incarnations of the god Wistnou; Group of idols worshipped in Asia.

did.unittitle: Tabula Asiae III,

scopecontent.p: — Armenia and Caspian Sea.
— In pencil: "Munster's Ptolemy 1545."
— Text on verso: "Tertia Asiae . . ."

did.unittitle: Tabula Asiae IIII,

scopecontent.p: — Near East

— Text on verso: "Qvarta . . ."

did.unittitle: Asia recens summa cura . . . , Auct. Henr. Hondio

scopecontent.p: — Text in Dutch on reverse.
— Small rips, tears and slight water damage.

did.unittitle: To the Right Honourable William, Lord Cowper . . ., Herman Moll, D. Midwinter, [Thomas Bowles], and Philip Overton, London,

scopecontent.p: — Asia and Africa.
— 7 insets. Wind vectors and compass rose.

Chart shewing the tracks across the North Atlantic Ocean of Don Christopher Columbus. (1st-4th voyages). Published By George P. Putnam, New York,

scopecontent.p: — North Atlantic 50 Lat. to the equator, showing parts of coasts of North and South America, Europe, and Africa.

Oceano Atlantico, Por D. Tomas Lopez,

scopecontent.p: — Area adjacent to the Tropic of Cancer.
